member.name: M:VideoInputSharp.VideoInput.IsFrameNew(System.Int32)
member.summary: Tells you when a new frame has arrived - you should call this if you have specified setAutoReconnectOnFreeze to true

member.name: M:VideoInputSharp.VideoInput.SetFormat(System.Int32,VideoInputSharp.VideoInputFormat)
member.summary: If you need to you can set your NTSC/PAL/SECAM preference here. if it is available it will be used. see #defines above for available formats - eg VI_NTSC_M or VI_PAL_B should be called after setupDevice can be called multiple times

member.name: M:VideoInputSharp.VideoInput.SetAutoReconnectOnFreeze(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Some devices will stop delivering frames after a while - this method gives you the option to try and reconnect to a device if videoInput detects that a device has stopped delivering frames. You MUST CALL isFrameNew every app loop for this to have any effect

member.name: M:VideoInputSharp.VideoInput.SetIdealFramerate(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Call before setupDevice. DirectShow will try and get the closest possible framerate to what is requested.

member.name: M:VideoInputSharp.VideoInput.SetUseCallback(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Choose to use callback based capture - or single threaded
